alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:15AM CDT until June 17 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR EASTERN CLINTON...MARION...SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 615 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Brownstown to near Central City, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Centralia, Salem, Nashville, Okawville, Sandoval, Wamac, Central City, Odin, Kinmundy, Lively Grove, Irvington, Patoka, Ashley, Farina, Omega, Stephen Forbes Station, Shobonier, Boulder, Shattuc and Fairman. This also includes Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between exits 109 and 135. Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 41 and 61. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
